extends GameObject

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingObject

        public MovingObject(int x,
                    int y,
                    java.util.HashMap<Direction,Animation> animations)
        Default constructor for movingobjects, creates animations, and sets all starting directions for objects to be down
        Parameters:
        x - x coord to create the object
        y - y coord to create the object
        animations - animations corresponding to each direction the directional object is moving

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates how the object is displayed on screen based on if the object has changed direction or if the frameDuration has elapsed between when the object was last drawn
        Overrides:
        tick in class GameObject

      • setCurrentLevel

        public void setCurrentLevel(Level currentLevel)
        Sets the movingObject's level so it knows other objects that it could reference for interactions
        Parameters:
        currentLevel - the level object containing all other objects in the level;

      • collideWithSolid

        public boolean collideWithSolid()
        Checks if the object has collided with an object that has the "isSolid" attribute equal to true and is not removed
        Returns:
        true if the object has collided with an object that is solid and is not removed else false

      • collideWithExplosion

        public boolean collideWithExplosion()
        Returns:
        true if the moving is colliding with an explosion that has not yet expired

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition(int oldX,
                          int oldY,
                          Direction oldDirection)
        Sets the object's position to an old X, old Y, old Direction
        Parameters:
        oldX - the object's new X coord
        oldY - the object's new Y coord
        oldDirection - the object's new Direction

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Returns:
        the object's current direction

      • updateCurrentAnimation

        public void updateCurrentAnimation()
        Updates the current animation to match the object's current direction

      • getCurrentAnimation

        public Animation getCurrentAnimation()
        Returns:
        the current animation object that the object is playing on screen
